ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Understanding the psychology behind how and when we are likely to change opinions/can convince others of something new!

I learned a lot about how and why people change their minds, and the effects that these factors have on our society and within our relationships. This class helped me improve in leading class discussions and summarizing articles.
How we think when forming decisions or impressions of others and what it takes to change our mind
I learnt about the literature on changing people's mind, and how to structure and write a full research proposal
The many ways people utilize the way we think in swaying opinions.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
strengths--very up to date with the best research and taught by a great professor.
Weaknesses- course was too large to really be a seminar. Should be max 15 students and would be great to be somewhat more structured than just a round table discussion

The class discussions are dynamic, and its nice that students take turns guiding them in their own style. I think talking about the final paper earlier in the semester and in more detail would be helpful, and more feedback on the reaction papers would help students know whether theyre on the right track or not.
Repetitive course structure which can get boring. The information was interesting but class could be slow. Also had no idea what my grade was until it came back at the end of the semester
Great discussion leading from Prof Ferguson, and really great syllabus
The materials are interesting, and professor Ferguson is great. The conversations was disorganized sometimes, and it's all at the whims of the discussion leaders.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Professor Ferguson is truly at the head of her field. She is new to teaching at Yale and I'm hopeful that her course will continue to evolve to be more active!
I would recommend this class to someone who is interested in this topic and is comfortable in the seminar setting.
No, unless you love the information and would be engaged no matter what
YES!! Prof Ferguson is incredible, the discussions and readings are thought provoking, and the peer group that the class brings together is fantastic
